intro: Hieracium carpegnae, commonly known as the Carpegna's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the upper leaves are smaller and more pointed. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its presence can indicate a healthy, undisturbed ecosystem due to its preference for stable environments.
